message_1: What is the value of 3x² + 2xy - 4y² when x = 5 and y = 2?
message_2:
To find the value of the expression 3x² + 2xy - 4y² when x = 5 and y = 2, we simply substitute the values of x and y into the expression:

3(5)² + 2(5)(2) - 4(2)²

= 3(25) + 2(10) - 4(4)

= 75 + 20 - 16

= 95 - 16

= 79

So, the value of the expression when x = 5 and y = 2 is 79.
